coinmachine

Class CoinMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • coinmachine.CoinMachine

  • public class CoinMachine
extends java.util.Observable
    A coin purse contains coins. It has a capacity (maximum number of coins it can hold), and methods for inserting coins, getting the balance, and withdrawing coins.
    Author:
    BTS and MRT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoinMachine(int capacity)
      Create a new coin machine with a fixed capacity.

      • getBalance

        public int getBalance()
        Get the value of all the coins in the machine.
        Returns:
        the total value of the coins

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        isFull tests whether the machine is full of coins.
        Returns:
        true if the machine is full to capacity

      • insert

        public boolean insert(Coin m)
        Insert a coin into the machine. If the machine is full it returns false. If the coin is invalid, throw an exception. @param m is a coin object to insert. Must not be null. @return true if coins successfully added, false if failure (machine full) @throws

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • getCoins

        public java.util.List<Coin> getCoins()
        Get a view of the coins, but don't allow the receiver to change the list.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of the coins in machine
